attributes.action: uphold at least one of the many petitions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We, the PM's constituents, request the PM & his office to rightfully uphold at least one of the many petitions. View closed e-petitions, most signed first, & it is impossible to find a Government response upholding the petition’s motions. Instead, a long-winded explanation is given eventually implying the Government’s position is correct, or that the issue is under consideration & the option people least desire is not ruled out. Approximately 20% of closed petitions reaching the needed signature threshold fail to receive an official response. 1.8 million Motorists requesting a road pricing scheme not be considered fail to have their request upheld. The e-petition site appears to make no obvious contribution to Parliamentary decisions, nor “direct democracy”. So long as no petitions are upheld, confidence in the petition system will be undermined, with flippant petitions like “make Jeremy Clarkson PM” being most interesting. Surely constituent’s opinions are of some importance?

rejection.details: If you wish to comment on the e-petitions system, please email "team@petitions.pm.gov.uk"
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
